name: 雅各书
description: 雅各写给分散各处的十二支派基督徒的信，强调信心与行为的关系

verses.zh: 作神和主耶稣基督仆人的雅各，请散住十二个支派之人的安。
verses.en: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, To the twelve tribes scattered among the nations: Greetings.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，你们落在百般试炼中，都要以为大喜乐。
verses.en: Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds,

verses.zh: 因为知道你们的信心经过试验，就生忍耐。
verses.en: because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.

verses.zh: 但忍耐也当成功，使你们成全、完备，毫无缺欠。
verses.en: Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.

verses.zh: 你们中间若有缺少智慧的，应当求那厚赐与众人，也不斥责人的神，主就必赐给他。
verses.en: If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you.

verses.zh: 只要凭着信心求，一点不疑惑；因为那疑惑的人，就像海中的波浪，被风吹动翻腾。
verses.en: But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind.

verses.zh: 这样的人不要想从主那里得什么。
verses.en: That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord.

verses.zh: 心怀二意的人，在他一切所行的路上都没有定见。
verses.en: Such a person is double-minded and unstable in all they do.

verses.zh: 卑微的弟兄升高，就该喜乐；
verses.en: Believers in humble circumstances ought to take pride in their high position.

verses.zh: 富足的降卑，也该如此。因为他必要过去，如同草上的花一样。
verses.en: But the rich should take pride in their humiliation—since they will pass away like a wild flower.

verses.zh: 太阳出来，热风刮起，草就枯干，花也凋谢，美容就消没了；那富足的人在他所行的事上也要这样衰残。
verses.en: For the sun rises with scorching heat and withers the plant; its blossom falls and its beauty is destroyed. In the same way, the rich will fade away even while they go about their business.

verses.zh: 忍受试探的人是有福的，因为他经过试验以后，必得生命的冠冕，这是主应许给那些爱他之人的。
verses.en: Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love him.

verses.zh: 人被试探，不可说：'我是被神试探'；因为神不能被恶试探，他也不试探人。
verses.en: When tempted, no one should say, 'God is tempting me.' For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone;

verses.zh: 但各人被试探，乃是被自己的私欲牵引诱惑的。
verses.en: but each person is tempted when they are dragged away by their own evil desire and enticed.

verses.zh: 私欲既怀了胎，就生出罪来；罪既长成，就生出死来。
verses.en: Then, after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is full-grown, gives birth to death.

verses.zh: 我亲爱的弟兄们，不要看错了。
verses.en: Don't be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.

verses.zh: 各样美善的恩赐和各样全备的赏赐都是从上头来的，从众光之父那里降下来的；在他并没有改变，也没有转动的影儿。
verses.en: Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.

verses.zh: 他按自己的旨意，用真道生了我们，叫我们在他所造的万物中好像初熟的果子。
verses.en: He chose to give us birth through the word of truth, that we might be a kind of firstfruits of all he created.

verses.zh: 我亲爱的弟兄们，这是你们所知道的。但你们各人要快快的听，慢慢的说，慢慢的动怒，
verses.en: My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.zh: 因为人的怒气并不成就神的义。
verses.en: because human anger does not produce the righteousness that God desires.

verses.zh: 所以，你们要脱去一切的污秽和盈余的邪恶，存温柔的心领受那所栽种的道，就是能救你们灵魂的道。
verses.en: Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you.

verses.zh: 只是你们要行道，不要单单听道，自己欺哄自己。
verses.en: Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.

verses.zh: 因为听道而不行道的，就像人对着镜子看自己本来的面目，
verses.en: Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like someone who looks at his face in a mirror

verses.zh: 看见，走后，随即忘了他的相貌如何。
verses.en: and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like.

verses.zh: 惟有详细察看那全备、使人自由之律法的，并且时常如此，这人既不是听了就忘，乃是实在行出来，就在他所行的事上必然得福。
verses.en: But whoever looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, and continues in it—not forgetting what they have heard, but doing it—they will be blessed in what they do.

verses.zh: 若有人自以为虔诚，却不勒住他的舌头，反欺哄自己的心，这人的虔诚是虚的。
verses.en: Those who consider themselves religious and yet do not keep a tight rein on their tongues deceive themselves, and their religion is worthless.

verses.zh: 在神我们的父面前，那清洁没有玷污的虔诚，就是看顾在患难中的孤儿寡妇，并且保守自己不沾染世俗。
verses.en: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，你们信奉我们荣耀的主耶稣基督，便不可按着外貌待人。
verses.en: My brothers and sisters, believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ must not show favoritism.

verses.zh: 若有一个人带着金戒指，穿着华美衣服，进你们的会堂去；又有一个穷人穿着肮脏衣服也进去；
verses.en: Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in filthy old clothes also comes in.

verses.zh: 你们就重看那穿华美衣服的人，说：'请坐在这好位上'；又对那穷人说：'你站在那里'，或'坐在我脚凳下边'。
verses.en: If you show special attention to the man wearing fine clothes and say, 'Here's a good seat for you,' but say to the poor man, 'You stand there' or 'Sit on the floor by my feet,'

verses.zh: 这岂不是你们偏心待人，用恶意断定人吗？
verses.en: have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?

verses.zh: 我亲爱的弟兄们，请听，神岂不是拣选了世上的贫穷人，叫他们在信上富足，并承受他所应许给那些爱他之人的国吗？
verses.en: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters: Has not God chosen those who are poor in the eyes of the world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised those who love him?

verses.zh: 你们反倒羞辱贫穷人。那富足人岂不是欺压你们、拉你们到公堂去吗？
verses.en: But you have dishonored the poor. Is it not the rich who are exploiting you? Are they not the ones who are dragging you into court?

verses.zh: 他们不是亵渎你们所敬奉的尊名吗？
verses.en: Are they not the ones who are blaspheming the noble name of him to whom you belong?

verses.zh: 经上记着说：'要爱人如己。'你们若全守这至尊的律法，才是好的。
verses.en: If you really keep the royal law found in Scripture, 'Love your neighbor as yourself,' you are doing right.

verses.zh: 但你们若按外貌待人，便是犯罪，被律法定为犯法的。
verses.en: But if you show favoritism, you sin and are convicted by the law as lawbreakers.

verses.zh: 因为凡遵守全律法的，只在一条上跌倒，他就是犯了众条。
verses.en: For whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.

verses.zh: 原来那说'不可奸淫'的，也说'不可杀人'；你就是不奸淫，却杀人，仍是成了犯律法的。
verses.en: For he who said, 'You shall not commit adultery,' also said, 'You shall not murder.' If you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a lawbreaker.

verses.zh: 你们既然要按使人自由的律法受审判，就该照这律法说话行事。
verses.en: Speak and act as those who are going to be judged by the law that gives freedom,

verses.zh: 因为那不怜悯人的，也要受无怜悯的审判；怜悯原是向审判夸胜。
verses.en: because judgment without mercy will be shown to anyone who has not been merciful. Mercy triumphs over judgment.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，若有人说自己有信心，却没有行为，有什么益处呢？这信心能救他吗？
verses.en: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but has no deeds? Can such faith save them?

verses.zh: 若是弟兄或是姐妹，赤身露体，又缺了日用的饮食；
verses.en: Suppose a brother or a sister is without clothes and daily food.

verses.zh: 你们中间有人对他们说：'平平安安的去吧！愿你们穿得暖，吃得饱'；却不给他们身体所需用的，这有什么益处呢？
verses.en: If one of you says to them, 'Go in peace; keep warm and well fed,' but does nothing about their physical needs, what good is it?

verses.zh: 这样，信心若没有行为就是死的。
verses.en: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.

verses.zh: 必有人说：'你有信心，我有行为；你将你没有行为的信心指给我看，我便藉着我的行为，将我的信心指给你看。'
verses.en: But someone will say, 'You have faith; I have deeds.' Show me your faith without deeds, and I will show you my faith by my deeds.

verses.zh: 你信神只有一位，你信的不错；鬼魔也信，却是战惊。
verses.en: You believe that there is one God. Good! Even the demons believe that—and shudder.

verses.zh: 虚浮的人哪，你愿意知道没有行为的信心是死的吗？
verses.en: You foolish person, do you want evidence that faith without deeds is useless?

verses.zh: 我们的祖宗亚伯拉罕把他儿子以撒献在坛上，岂不是因行为称义吗？
verses.en: Was not our father Abraham considered righteous for what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?

verses.zh: 可见，信心是与他的行为并行，而且信心因着行为才得成全。
verses.en: You see that his faith and his actions were working together, and his faith was made complete by what he did.

verses.zh: 这就应验经上所说：'亚伯拉罕信神，这就算为他的义。'他又得称为神的朋友。
verses.en: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, 'Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,' and he was called God's friend.

verses.zh: 这样看来，人称义是因着行为，不是单因着信。
verses.en: You see that a person is considered righteous by what they do and not by faith alone.

verses.zh: 妓女喇合接待使者，又放他们从别的路上出去，不也是一样因行为称义吗？
verses.en: In the same way, was not even Rahab the prostitute considered righteous for what she did when she gave lodging to the spies and sent them off in a different direction?

verses.zh: 身体没有灵魂是死的，信心没有行为也是死的。
verses.en: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，不要多人作师傅，因为晓得我们要受更重的判断。
verses.en: Not many of you should become teachers, my fellow believers, because you know that we who teach will be judged more strictly.

verses.zh: 原来我们在许多事上都有过失；若有人在话语上没有过失，他就是完全人，也能勒住自己的全身。
verses.en: We all stumble in many ways. Anyone who is never at fault in what they say is perfect, able to keep their whole body in check.

verses.zh: 我们若把嚼环放在马嘴里，叫它顺服，就能调动它的全身。
verses.en: When we put bits into the mouths of horses to make them obey us, we can turn the whole animal.

verses.zh: 看哪，船只虽然甚大，又被大风催逼，只用小小的舵，就随着掌舵的意思转动。
verses.en: Or take ships as an example. Although they are so large and are driven by strong winds, they are steered by a very small rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.

verses.zh: 这样，舌头在百体里也是最小的，却能说大话。看哪，最小的火能点着最大的树林。
verses.en: Likewise, the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes great boasts. Consider what a great forest is set on fire by a small spark.

verses.zh: 舌头就是火，在我们百体中，舌头是个罪恶的世界，能污秽全身，也能把生命的轮子点起来，并且是从地狱里点着的。
verses.en: The tongue also is a fire, a world of evil among the parts of the body. It corrupts the whole body, sets the whole course of one's life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell.

verses.zh: 各类的走兽、飞禽、昆虫、水族，本来都可以制伏，也已经被人制伏了；
verses.en: All kinds of animals, birds, reptiles and sea creatures are being tamed and have been tamed by mankind,

verses.zh: 惟独舌头没有人能制伏，是不止息的恶物，满了害死人的毒气。
verses.en: but no human being can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.

verses.zh: 我们用舌头颂赞那为主、为父的，又用舌头咒诅那照着神形像被造的人。
verses.en: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God's likeness.

verses.zh: 颂赞和咒诅从一个口里出来！我的弟兄们，这是不应当的！
verses.en: Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be.

verses.zh: 泉源从一个眼里能发出甜苦两样的水吗？
verses.en: Can both fresh water and salt water flow from the same spring?

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，无花果树能生橄榄吗？葡萄树能结无花果吗？咸水里也不能发出甜水来。
verses.en: My brothers and sisters, can a fig tree bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? Neither can a salt spring produce fresh water.

verses.zh: 你们中间谁是有智慧有见识的呢？他就当在智慧的温柔上显出他的善行来。
verses.en: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let them show it by their good life, by deeds done in the humility that comes from wisdom.

verses.zh: 你们心里若怀着苦毒的嫉妒和分争，就不可自夸，也不可说谎话抵挡真道。
verses.en: But if you harbor bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast about it or deny the truth.

verses.zh: 这样的智慧不是从上头来的，乃是属地的，属情欲的，属鬼魔的。
verses.en: Such 'wisdom' does not come down from heaven but is earthly, unspiritual, demonic.

verses.zh: 在何处有嫉妒、分争，就在何处有扰乱和各样的坏事。
verses.en: For where you have envy and selfish ambition, there you find disorder and every evil practice.

verses.zh: 惟独从上头来的智慧，先是清洁，后是和平，温良柔顺，满有怜悯，多结善果，没有偏见，没有假冒。
verses.en: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.

verses.zh: 并且使人和平的，是用和平所栽种的义果。
verses.en: Peacemakers who sow in peace reap a harvest of righteousness.

verses.zh: 你们中间的争战、斗殴是从哪里来的呢？不是从你们百体中战斗之私欲来的吗？
verses.en: What causes fights and quarrels among you? Don't they come from your desires that battle within you?

verses.zh: 你们贪恋，还是得不着；你们杀害嫉妒，又斗殴争战，也不能得。你们得不着，是因为你们不求。
verses.en: You desire but do not have, so you kill. You covet but you cannot get what you want, so you quarrel and fight. You do not have because you do not ask God.

verses.zh: 你们求也得不着，是因为你们妄求，要浪费在你们的宴乐中。
verses.en: When you ask, you do not receive, because you ask with wrong motives, that you may spend what you get on your pleasures.

verses.zh: 你们这些淫乱的人哪，岂不知与世俗为友就是与神为敌吗？所以凡想要与世俗为友的，就是与神为敌了。
verses.en: You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world means enmity against God? Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

verses.zh: 你们想经上所说是徒然的吗？神所赐、住在我们里面的灵，是恋爱至于嫉妒吗？
verses.en: Or do you think Scripture says without reason that he jealously longs for the spirit he has caused to dwell in us?

verses.zh: 但他赐更多的恩典，所以经上说：'神阻挡骄傲的人，赐恩给谦卑的人。'
verses.en: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: 'God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble.'

verses.zh: 故此，你们要顺服神。务要抵挡魔鬼，魔鬼就必离开你们逃跑了。
verses.en: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

verses.zh: 你们亲近神，神就必亲近你们。有罪的人哪，要洁净你们的手！心怀二意的人哪，要清洁你们的心！
verses.en: Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

verses.zh: 你们要愁苦、悲哀、哭泣，将喜笑变作悲哀，欢乐变作愁闷。
verses.en: Grieve, mourn and wail. Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom.

verses.zh: 务要在主面前自卑，主就必叫你们升高。
verses.en: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们不可彼此批评。人若批评弟兄，论断弟兄，就是批评律法，论断律法。你若论断律法，就不是遵行律法，乃是判断律法的。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, do not slander one another. Anyone who speaks against a brother or sister or judges them speaks against the law and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, but sitting in judgment on it.

verses.zh: 设立律法和判断人的，只有一位，就是那能救人也能灭人的。你是谁，竟敢论断别人呢？
verses.en: There is only one Lawgiver and Judge, the one who is able to save and destroy. But you—who are you to judge your neighbor?

verses.zh: 嗐！你们有话说：'今天明天我们要往某城里去，在那里住一年，作买卖得利。'
verses.en: Now listen, you who say, 'Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money.'

verses.zh: 其实明天如何，你们还不知道。你们的生命是什么呢？你们原来是一片云雾，出现少时就不见了。
verses.en: Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes.

verses.zh: 你们只当说：'主若愿意，我们就可以活着，也可以作这事，或作那事。'
verses.en: Instead, you ought to say, 'If it is the Lord's will, we will live and do this or that.'

verses.zh: 现今你们竟以张狂夸口；凡这样夸口都是恶的。
verses.en: As it is, you boast in your arrogant schemes. All such boasting is evil.

verses.zh: 人若知道行善，却不去行，这就是他的罪了。
verses.en: If anyone, then, knows the good they ought to do and doesn't do it, it is sin for them.

verses.zh: 嗐！你们这些富足人哪，应当哭泣、号啕，因为将有苦难临到你们身上。
verses.en: Now listen, you rich people, weep and wail because of the misery that is coming on you.

verses.zh: 你们的财物坏了，衣服也被虫子咬了。
verses.en: Your wealth has rotted, and moths have eaten your clothes.

verses.zh: 你们的金银都长了锈；那锈要证明你们的不是，又要吃你们的肉，如同火烧。你们在这末世只知积攒钱财。
verses.en: Your gold and silver are corroded. Their corrosion will testify against you and eat your flesh like fire. You have hoarded wealth in the last days.

verses.zh: 工人给你们收割庄稼，你们亏欠他们的工钱，这工钱有声音呼叫，并且那收割之人的冤声已经入了万军之主的耳了。
verses.en: Look! The wages you failed to pay the workers who mowed your fields are crying out against you. The cries of the harvesters have reached the ears of the Lord Almighty.

verses.zh: 你们在世上享美福，好宴乐，当宰杀的日子竟娇养你们的心。
verses.en: You have lived on earth in luxury and self-indulgence. You have fattened yourselves in the day of slaughter.

verses.zh: 你们定了义人的罪，把他杀害，他也不抵挡你们。
verses.en: You have condemned and murdered the innocent one, who was not opposing you.

verses.zh: 弟兄们哪，你们要忍耐，直到主来。看哪，农夫忍耐等候地里宝贵的出产，直到得了秋雨春雨。
verses.en: Be patient, then, brothers and sisters, until the Lord's coming. See how the farmer waits for the land to yield its valuable crop, patiently waiting for the autumn and spring rains.

verses.zh: 你们也当忍耐，坚固你们的心，因为主来的日子近了。
verses.en: You too, be patient and stand firm, because the Lord's coming is near.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们不要彼此埋怨，免得受审判。看哪，审判的主站在门前了。
verses.en: Don't grumble against one another, brothers and sisters, or you will be judged. The Judge is standing at the door!

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们要把那先前奉主名说话的众先知当作能受苦能忍耐的榜样。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, as an example of patience in the face of suffering, take the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.

verses.zh: 那先前忍耐的人，我们称他们是有福的。你们听见过约伯的忍耐，也知道主给他的结局，明显主是满心怜悯，大有慈悲。
verses.en: As you know, we count as blessed those who have persevered. You have heard of Job's perseverance and have seen what the Lord finally brought about. The Lord is full of compassion and mercy.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，最要紧的是不可起誓；不可指着天起誓，也不可指着地起誓，无论何誓都不可起。你们说话，是，就说是；不是，就说不是，免得你们落在审判之下。
verses.en: Above all, my brothers and sisters, do not swear—not by heaven or by earth or by anything else. All you need to say is a simple 'Yes' or 'No.' Otherwise you will be condemned.

verses.zh: 你们中间有受苦的呢，他就该祷告；有喜乐的呢，他就该歌颂。
verses.en: Is anyone among you in trouble? Let them pray. Is anyone happy? Let them sing songs of praise.

verses.zh: 你们中间有病的呢，他就该请教会的长老来；他们可以奉主的名用油抹他，为他祷告。
verses.en: Is anyone among you sick? Let them call the elders of the church to pray over them and anoint them with oil in the name of the Lord.

verses.zh: 出于信心的祷告要救那病人，主必叫他起来；他若犯了罪，也必蒙赦免。
verses.en: And the prayer offered in faith will make the sick person well; the Lord will raise them up. If they have sinned, they will be forgiven.

verses.zh: 所以你们要彼此认罪，互相代求，使你们可以得医治。义人祈祷所发的力量是大有功效的。
verses.en: Therefore confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective.

verses.zh: 以利亚与我们是一样性情的人，他恳切祷告，求不要下雨，雨就三年零六个月不下在地上。
verses.en: Elijah was a human being, even as we are. He prayed earnestly that it would not rain, and it did not rain on the land for three and a half years.

verses.zh: 他又祷告，天就降下雨来，地也生出土产。
verses.en: Again he prayed, and the heavens gave rain, and the earth produced its crops.

verses.zh: 我的弟兄们，你们中间若有失迷真道的，有人使他回转，
verses.en: My brothers and sisters, if one of you should wander from the truth and someone should bring that person back,

verses.zh: 这人该知道：叫一个罪人从迷路上转回便是救一个灵魂不死，并且遮盖许多的罪。
verses.en: remember this: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of their way will save them from death and cover over a multitude of sins.
